options.label: A
options.text: To punish them for their alleged disloyalty

options.label: B
options.text: To assimilate them into white American society

options.label: C
options.text: To provide them with education and job training

options.label: D
options.text: To promote their cultural heritage

multiple-choice.question: How did the US government use the "model minority" narrative to discredit the Civil Rights movement?

options.label: A
options.text: By highlighting the struggles of Asian Americans

options.label: B
options.text: By presenting Asian Americans as a success story and criticizing Black Americans

options.label: C
options.text: By ignoring the experiences of Asian Americans

options.label: D
options.text: By promoting unity between Asian and Black Americans

multiple-choice.question: What is the psychological phenomenon that occurs when members of a group feel pressure to avoid confirming negative stereotypes?

options.label: A
options.text: Stereotype threat

options.label: B
options.text: Model minority myth

options.label: C
options.text: Racial hierarchy

options.label: D
options.text: Social identity theory

multiple-choice.question: How can the "model minority" stereotype negatively impact Asian individuals?

options.label: A
options.text: By creating unrealistic expectations and pressure to perform well

options.label: B
options.text: By providing them with more opportunities and resources

options.label: C
options.text: By promoting their cultural heritage and identity

options.label: D
options.text: By ignoring their experiences and struggles

multiple-choice.question: Why are social programs catering to Asian communities often overlooked or cut?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they are assumed to need less support than other disadvantaged groups

options.label: B
options.text: Because they are considered too expensive to maintain

options.label: C
options.text: Because they are not effective in addressing the needs of Asian Americans

options.label: D
options.text: Because they are not well-publicized or known

multiple-choice.question: What is the ultimate effect of the "model minority" stereotype on our understanding of Asian Americans?

options.label: A
options.text: It promotes a nuanced and accurate understanding of their experiences

options.label: B
options.text: It reduces them to a one-dimensional image and hinders our ability to understand their history and struggles

options.label: C
options.text: It highlights their successes and achievements

options.label: D
options.text: It ignores their experiences and struggles
